TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit ECDsaCng extends System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsa
Public NotInheritable Class ECDsaCng Inherits ECDsa
public ref class ECDsaCng sealed : System::Security::Cryptography::ECDsa

Docs.summary: Provides a Cryptography Next Generation (CNG) implementation of the Elliptic Curve Digital Signature Algorithm (ECDSA).

remarks.format:
## Remarks This class should only be used directly when doing platform interop with the Windows CNG library. When platform interop is not needed, you should use the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsa.Create%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> factory methods instead of a specific derived implementation.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsaCng> class to sign a message and how to use the signature to verify that the message has not been altered.
:::code language="csharp" source="~/snippets/csharp/System.Security.Cryptography/ECDsaCng/Overview/program.cs" id="Snippet1"::: :::code language="vb" source="~/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/ecdsacng/vb/program.vb" id="Snippet1":::

[<System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")>]

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a random key pair.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
This constructor does not generate a new public/private keypair immediately. This constructor sets the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsaCng.KeySize> property to 521 and when a key is needed the saved size is used to identify the target curve. If a key is loaded via the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsaCng.ImportParameters%2A> method, or other key import method, the key size from this constructor has no meaning.

Docs.exception: Cryptography Next Generation (CNG) classes are not supported on this system.

new System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsaCng : int -> System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsaCng
public: ECDsaCng(int keySize);

Docs.param: The size of the key. Valid key sizes are 256, 384, and 521 bits.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified target key size.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
This constructor does not generate a new public/private keypair immediately. This constructor sets the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsaCng.KeySize> property to the provided value and when a key is needed the saved size is used to identify the target curve. If a key is loaded via the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsaCng.ImportParameters%2A> method, or other key import method, the key size from this constructor has no meaning.

Docs.exception: Cryptography Next Generation (CNG) classes are not supported on this system.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `curve` must validate (that is, it must return `true`) when passed to the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECCurve.Validate%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method and must be either a named or explicit prime.

Attribute.AttributeName: [get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")]
[<get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")>]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the hash algorithm to use when signing and verifying data.
Docs.value: An object that specifies the hash algorithm.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property accepts the following algorithms: <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngAlgorithm.MD5%2A>, <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngAlgorithm.Sha1%2A>, <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngAlgorithm.Sha256%2A>, <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngAlgorithm.Sha384%2A>, and <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngAlgorithm.Sha512%2A>.
Other custom hash algorithms may also be used.
Due to collision problems with MD5 and SHA1, Microsoft recommends <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngAlgorithm.Sha256%2A>. The default algorithm is <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngAlgorithm.Sha256%2A>.
This property is not used if you are signing or verifying data that is already hashed.

Docs.summary: Replaces the existing key that the current instance is working with by creating a new for the parameters structure.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If `parameters` contains only <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECParameters.Q>, only a public key is imported. If `parameters` also contains <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECParameters.D>, a full key pair is imported. The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECParameters.Curve> field specifies the type of the curve to import.

Docs.exception: references a curve that cannot be imported.
references a curve that is not supported by this platform.

MemberSignature.Value: public override int KeySize { get; set; }
.property instance int32 KeySize
Public Overrides Property KeySize As Integer
member this.KeySize : int with get, set
public: virtual property int KeySize { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the size, in bits, of the key modulus used by the asymmetric algorithm.
Docs.value: The size, in bits, of the key modulus used by the asymmetric algorithm.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
Setting this property to its current value has no visible effect. Setting this property to a new legal value discards the current key, but defers creation of a new key until one is needed.
Because key sizes do not uniquely identify elliptic curves, the use of the property setter is discouraged. To generate a new key on a specific curve, use the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsaCng.GenerateKey%2A> method.

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.Security.Cryptography.KeySizes[] LegalKeySizes { get; }
.property instance class System.Security.Cryptography.KeySizes[] LegalKeySizes
Public Overrides ReadOnly Property LegalKeySizes As KeySizes()
member this.LegalKeySizes : System.Security.Cryptography.KeySizes[]
public: virtual property cli::array <System::Security::Cryptography::KeySizes ^> ^ LegalKeySizes { cli::array <System::Security::Cryptography::KeySizes ^> ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the key sizes, in bits, that are supported by the property setter.
Docs.value: An array that contains the key sizes supported by the property setter.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
In Elliptic Curve Cryptography (ECC) the key size is not the only input into the key generation process, it is derived from the curve parameters for a specific elliptic curve. This property reports only three legal key sizes: 256, 384, and 521 bits. When the key size is used alone as a basis for key generation, the supported sizes map to the named curves secp256r1 (aka NIST P-256), secp384r1 (aka NIST P-384), and secp521r1 (aka NIST P-521).
When executed on Windows 10, this class supports many additional named curves, but that is not reflected in this property.

Docs.summary: Generates a signature.

MemberSignature.Value: public byte[] SignData (byte[] data);
.method public hidebysig instance unsigned int8[] SignData(unsigned int8[] data) cil managed
Public Function SignData (data As Byte()) As Byte()
override this.SignData : byte[] -> byte[]
public: cli::array <System::Byte> ^ SignData(cli::array <System::Byte> ^ data);
member this.SignData : byte[] -> byte[]

Docs.param: The message data to be signed.
Docs.summary: Generates a signature for the specified data.
Docs.returns: A digital signature for the specified data.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method generates a signature for the specified data by hashing the input data using the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsaCng.HashAlgorithm%2A> property, and then signing the result.
The <xref:System.Security.Permissions.KeyContainerPermissionFlags.Sign?displayProperty=nameWithType> flag is required if the Cryptography Next Generation (CNG) key is not randomly generated by the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsaCng> object.

Docs.exception: The key information that is associated with the instance does not have a private key.

Docs.summary: Verifies the digital signature of the specified data.
Docs.returns: if the signature is valid; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method generates a signature for the given data by hashing the input data using the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsaCng.HashAlgorithm%2A> property, and then signing the result.
